thread.title: High school roundup: Stiven Florez rallied Fonda to victory
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Stiven Florez rallied Fonda to victory - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Stiven Florez rallied Fonda to victory
text:
Stiven Florez scored a hat trick to rally No. 17 Fonda to a 3-2 win over No. 16 Johnstown in a Class B boys' soccer sectional game Wednesday in Johnstown.
Florez got the ball at midfield, beat a defender and fired in the game-winning goal from just outside the box with seven minutes left.
Jacob Billa and Jake Pietre scored in the first 10 minutes of the game to stake the Sir Bills to a 2-0 lead, but Florez took over from there. He scored the Braves' first goal with seven minutes left in the half.
On the tying goal, Florez received the ball at midfield and beat two defenders before getting off a shot.
Braves goaltender Mitch Araya made 10 saves, including two from point-blank range to earn the win.
Johnstown jumped out to an early lead when Billa kicked in a ball that was deflected to him off a long throw-in from Jordan Herron . Pietre scored on a long shot that Araya was able to touch, but could not contain.
More boys' soccer: Anthony Clements scored the game's lone goal to lift Mechanicville over Watervliet in a Class B first-round game. Mitch Capitula made eight saves to lead Watervliet. ... Greenville coasted to a 6-1 victory over Saratoga Catholic in a Class C first-round clash. Sam Statham scored two goals to lead the fifth-seeded Spartans. ... Luke Vanderminden had two goals in a 3-1 win by Lake George against Cambridge in another Class C first-round game. Lake George climbed to 15-2 with the victory. ... Dylan Klock and Devan Battisti each scored two goals to help Oppenheim-Ephratah-St. Johnsville cruise past Hartford in a Class D first-round matchup. After trailing 1-0 at halftime, OESJ erupted for five second-half goals to advance to Friday's quarterfinal round, in which they will travel to take on top-seeded Fort Ann at 2 p.m.
Girls' soccer: Hannah Almy scored four goals to lead Cobleskill past Cairo-Durham, 4-1, in a Class B opening-round contest. ... Brittany La Plant also scored four to help Queensbury roll to a 7-1 win over Lansingburgh in a Class A first-round game.
Field hockey: Second-seeded Saratoga coasted to a 5-1 win over Columbia in the Class A quarterfinal round. Maggie Conway scored two goals to lead the Blue Streaks, who improved to 12-4 overall with the victory. ... Niskayuna nipped Bethlehem, 1-0, in another Class A quarterfinal. The fifth-seeded Silver Warriors will take on top-seeded Shenendehowa, which had a bye, on Oct. 28 at Clifton Park in the semifinal round.
